text: Birkir Már Sævarsson (born 11 November 1984 in Reykjavik, Iceland) is an Icelandic footballer who can play as a right fullback, right winger, left fullback or center back. He currently plays for the Swedish club Hammarby Fotboll and the Iceland national football team. He was included in Iceland's UEFA Euro 2016 squad. == Statistics == Season Club Division League Cup Total Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals 2002 Valur U23 Icelandic Cup 0 0 2 0 2 0 2003 Valur Úrvalsdeild 8 0 0 0 8 0 2004 1. deild 11 0 2 0 13 0 2005 Úrvalsdeild 1 0 2 0 3 0 2006 18 0 2 0 20 0 2007 17 1 2 0 19 1 2008 11 1 3 0 14 1 2008 SK Brann Tippeligaen 8 1 0 0 8 1 2009 26 2 3 1 29 3 2010 27 2 1 0 28 2 2011 27 4 6 0 33 4 2012 30 2 5 2 35 4 2013 30 3 2 0 30 3 2014 20 1 3 0 23 1 2015 Hammarby Allsvenskan 28 2 5 0 33 2 2016 3 0 5 0 8 0 Career Total 243 18 37 3 280 21 ===International goals=== # Date Venue Opponent Score Result Competition 1 6 June 2016 Laugardalsvöllur, Reykjavík, Iceland 2–0 4–0 Friendly == Honours == *Icelandic Premier League: 2007 *Icelandic Cup: 2005 *Icelandic League Cup: 2008 == References == == Other websites == *Birkir Már Sævarsson at National- Football-Teams.com Category:1984 births Category:Living people Category:Icelandic footballers
